page.title: 07KILDRUMMY CASTLE
page.content:
The castle which is now in ruins had a very violent history.Built in the 13th century it was one of the strongholds of Robert the Bruce and was often under siege by the English forces. Later it became the seat of the Earls of Mar. It passed through many hands and in the 17th century was the scene of further battles, this time between the Royalists and Roundheads, when it was captured by Cromwells troops in 1654. Later again it was held for the old Pretender, James 111. when the 1715 rising failed, the castle was dismantled and became " the quarry for the district". In 1951 it was given to the Dept. of Environment for preservation. Altough only a ruin,it
is a great tourist attraction, drawing 7,ooo vistors a year to the area.
